citeinfo.title: Seasonal and Annual Mean Maritime Surface Weather and Sea Data, and Seasonal Upper-level Winds and Temperature for the USSR (pub.1950)

abstract.p: Publication Title: Morskoi Atlas = Marine atlas. Text in Russian. For full detailed English translation see 'An Evaluation of the "Morskoi Atlas" (With Translations from Volumes I and II)'.
The Morskoi Atlas is devided into three parts: Volume I, navigation and geography; Volume II, physical geography; Volume III, military and political geography.

Contains a comprehensive treatment of the marine environment of the earth. Contains sea charts and maps of important ports and naval bases, bathymetry, sea level, nature and velocity of currents, ice boundaries, ocean routes, national frontiers, earthquakes, volcanos, sediments, sea surface temperature, salinity, and density, range of tides, wind waves and swell, distribution of cetacea, sirenia, pinnipeds, ocean fishes, marine birds and algae, atmospheric pressure, cloudiness, fog, and storms.

descript.purpose: A basic cartographic manual of ocean and seas. This publication is in the National Climatic Data Center's Foreign Data Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by the NCDC from many nations over the years.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
